content: gailleann cardigan a cable and seed stitch raglan-style cardigan by christina danaee gailleann is an open cardigan featuring a celtic inspired cable collar band and seed stitch all over named after an old irish word for storm gailleann is made to keep you warm through the wildest squall the seed stitch body and inset pockets add a durability to this sweater that helps it double as a coat in more moderate climates magpie fiber s sturdy domestic worsted yarn shows beautiful definition in both the cables and the seed stitch gailleann is knit from the top-down with raglan shaping knitting the cable collar band simultaneously www christinadanaee com 1 text and photos ©christina danaee 2018 instructions sizes 1 2 3 4 5 collar finished bust measurements using waste yarn and us 7-4 5mm needle provisionally 34 39 42 47 50 - 86 99 107 119 127 cm cast on 30sts *join working yarn and begin working row 1 of cable chart continue working chart in this manner through y arn row 20 magpie fibers domestic worsted repeat row 1-6 once more ** 100% merino slip stitches onto a stitch holder break yarn 200 yards / 115 grams carefully remove provisional cast on and transfer live 6 7 8 9 10 skeins tactical stitches to working needle repeat from * to ** -or- 1200 1400 1600 1800 2000 yds of an equivalent worsted weight yarn neck setup row with rs facing work row 7 of cable chart materials over first 30sts pm pick up and knit 35 41 45 51 us 7 - 4 5mm circular needle 32 or longer 53 sts pm place 30sts from stitch holder to working us 7 4 5mm dpns optional for sleeves needle work row 7 of cable chart over last 30sts stitch markers tapestry needle for weaving in ends setup row 2 ws work row 8 of cable chart over first scrap yarn of similar weight for provisional cast on 30sts sm k1 pm p1 pm k3 pm p1 pm k23 29 33 39 stitch holder 41 pm p1 pm k3 pm p1 pm k1 sm work row 8 of cable chart over last 30sts gauge neck increase 15sts x 28 row = 4 -10cm using us 7 - 4 5mm over seed stitch blocked row 1 rs work corresponding cable chart row over 26sts x 24 row = 4 -10cm using us 7-4 5mm over cable first 30sts sm m1l k1 m1r sm k1 sm m1l k1 p1 k1 chart pattern blocked m1r sm k1 sm m1l k1 p1 repeat to 1st before m k1 m1r sm k1 sm m1l k1 p1 k1 m1r sm k1 sm m1l k1 m1r sm work corresponding cable chart row over techniques used last 30sts 10sts increase provisional cast on knitting in the round row 2 ws work corresponding cable chart row over knitting from a cable chart first 30sts sm p1 k1 repeat to 1st before m p1 *sm i-cord bind off p1 sm p1 k1
